{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with fever, headache, and ataxia, along with dilated ventricles and significant basal exudates on brain imaging. These findings are suggestive of tuberculous meningitis. In tuberculous meningitis, the CSF findings typically include lymphocytosis, low glucose, and high protein levels. Therefore, the most likely CSF finding in this case would be lymphocytosis, low glucose, and high protein.", "answer_choice": "A"}
